adrFormatAddress: 5th floor, Grand Central Tower, 140 E 45th St #2, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: This company will cheat you!  Beware!  They tell you at the beginning everything is fine and quote a "final" price for the complete rental.  I asked if this was "everything", and was told "yes, this is everything for the dates of the lease you've given me."  After the lease is over, the slap on a $169.12 "early Lease Termination fee".  After calling, I get the typical response, "I don't know who told you that, but our contract has the fee listed in it."  They are dishonest and deceitful and commit consumer fraud.  Use at your own risk!  You've be forewarned!

originalText.text: CORT Furniture is a need for every student that is moving to NYC. In less than a few days, I was able to fully furnish my empty studio apartment without breaking the bank. Assistance was super quick, Justin P. was amazing and super helpful! The delivery was super smooth and the delivery guys were super friendly and got the job done quick. Highly recommend CORT Furniture!

text.text: CORT Furniture is a need for every student that is moving to NYC. In less than a few days, I was able to fully furnish my empty studio apartment without breaking the bank. Highly recommend CORT Furniture!

originalText.text:
I am so disappointed it Cort Furniture. I can't even believe they would treat a customer this way during these times.

My 10 year old son booked a broadway show in NYC and I relocated from Indiana for him. We leased our furniture for the apartment from Cort. Due to the National State of Emergency, broadway closed as did everything that is nonessential. So we had to move back home. I called Cort and explained our situation to Kathleen Layton, who told me over the phone that my lease would be terminated no fees and I would not have any additional payments. Cort Furniture even came and picked up the furniture from the apartment. Then Cort Furniture charged me for April. I emailed Kathleen to question the charge and she informed me that I would have to pay the remainder of the lease.

So 1st problem and horrible service. She told me on the phone I would not be charge anything more and yet now I have been charged and she emailed that I have to pay the remainder of the lease when I don't even have the furniture.

2nd problem, my son doesn't have a job and can't pay for the furniture that we don't even have and are not even using. Cort Furniture picked the furniture back up and they have it.

3rd problem, what company in these times would treat their customers like this. The apartment complex isn't even charging me anymore. They terminated our lease. Anyone, or company that has good moral ethics would not rob their customers during these horrible times.

I would not every recommend Cort Furniture NYC or any Cort Furniture.

originalText.text: This confident company has been my leg on time of need. It has assisted me in my change from bad to better and from better to best. I used there rental furniture. For short to long term leaving from Brooklyn to queens because of a fire. The movers ate friendly but quick and the set up is respectable. Thanks a million

originalText.text: Good for people visiting New York for few months. The website and store is pretty neat and offers a wide selection to furnish your house. They have delivery and collection services as well- for a small fee. Worth checking out if you are in need to get rental furniture.
